text: was a town located in Kitasaitama District, Saitama Prefecture, Japan. As of 2003, the town had an estimated population of 20,105 and a density of 702.97 persons per km². The total area was 28.60 km². On March 23, 2010, Kisai, along with the towns of Kitakawabe and Ōtone (all from Kitasaitama District), was merged into the expanded city of Kazo. Kitasaitama District was dissolved as a result of this merger. Category:Dissolved municipalities of Saitama Prefecture Category:Kazo, Saitama
title: Kisai, Saitama
